questions.question: Welcome to the Johns Hopkins Long COVID Questionnaire
options: This questionnaire asks you about your exposure to COVID-19 and how it has affected your life beyond your infection. Please know that participation in this survey is optional, and that while responses will be shared on the aggregate, individual responses will be free of all personal identifiers.

questions.title: Consent
questions.question: The following information will be collected to better understand your experience with COVID-19. Once collected, all data will be de-identified and aggregated to contribute to data seen on the map.

questions.title: Demographics
questions.question: Please enter the following demographic information:

questions.title: Intro
questions.question: In total, since the beginning of the pandemic in the US (January 2020), how many times do you think you have been infected with COVID‐19?

questions.instructions: The following questions refer to your most recent (new) COVID-19 infection If you know or think you had multiple infections, please answer the following questions based on your most recent infection
questions.title: COVID
questions.question: When do you know or think you had COVID-19?

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: Did you take a COVID test at that time?

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: What were your test results? Check all that apply. “Positive” means the test showed COVID-19.
options: Positive antigen ("rapid") test at a clinic, tent, or other facility
Positive test, but unsure if antigen or PCR
I did not have a positive test

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: Were you hospitalized for COVID-19?
options: Yes, I was hospitalized due to health problems relating to COVID-19
I was hospitalized, but it was not related to COVID-19 symptoms

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: Did you have any symptoms?

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: When your symptoms were at their worst, did they prevent you from going about your daily activities?

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: Did you take any of the following medications? Check all that apply.
options: Oral steroids, such as dexamethasone, prednisone, or prednisolone
I took medications for COVID-19 but I don't know what they were
I did not take any medications for COVID-19

questions.title: Recovery
questions.question: Would you say that you are completely recovered from COVID-19 now?

questions.title: Recovery
questions.question: How long did it take for you to recover from your most recent infection

questions.title: Recovery
questions.question: Do you think that you are experiencing, or have ever experienced, what has been called “long COVID,” or symptoms that continue for at least a month after your infection?

questions.title: Vaccination
questions.question: In total, how many COVID-19 vaccine shots have you received?

questions.title: Vaccination
questions.question: When was your most recent COVID vaccine?

questions.title: Vaccination
questions.question: Which type of COVID vaccine was your last shot?

questions.title: General Health
questions.question: Please answer the following questions based on your most recent health status
options: In general, would you say your health is
In general, would you say your quality of life is
In general, how would you rate your physical health
In general, how would you rate your mental health, including your mood and your ability to think?
In general, how would you rate your satisfaction with your social activities and relationships?

In general, please rate how well you carry out your usual social activities and roles. (This includes activities at home, at work and in your community, and responsibilities as a parent, child, spouse, employee, friend, etc.)?

questions.title: Symptoms
questions.question: During the past month, have you had any of the following symptoms? If yes, please tell us if the symptom was mild (not very bothersome), moderate (somewhat bothersome), or severe (very bothersome)
options: Feeling sick after you exert yourself physically or mentally
Loss of or change in smell or taste
Bladder problems including incontinence, trouble passing urine or emptying bladder
Nerve problems including tremor, shaking, numbness, tingling, or burning sensation
Feeling faint, lightheaded or dizzy after standing up
Excessively dry mouth or excessive thirst
Problems with hearing (hearing loss, ringing in ears)
Changes to menstrual cycle or menopause symptoms (such as hot flashes)
Changes in desire for, comfort with or capacity for sex

questions.title: Medical Conditions
questions.question: Since the beginning of 2020, has a health care provider given you a new diagnosis of any of the following conditions?
options: Heart problems, such as heart failure or arrhythmia
Lung problems, such as asthma, COPD, or fibrosis
Blood clots in the lung (“pulmonary embolism”) leg or arm (“deep vein thrombosis”)
Memory or cognitive impairment or dementia
Stomach problems or gastrointestinal disease, like stomach ulcer or gastrointestinal disease
Psychological problems or psychiatric problems, like depression or anxiety or psychosis
No new diagnoses since the beginning of 2020

questions.title: Social Determinants
questions.question: Do you currently have some form of health insurance to help pay for medical bills?

questions.title: Social Determinants
questions.question: Do you currently have some form of health insurance to help pay for medical bills?

questions.title: Social Determinants
questions.question: What is your current work situation?
options: On leave from a job working outside the home (e.g, sick leave, family leave, maternity leave)

questions.title: Create Account
questions.question: In order to better understand Long COVID, we would like to check in to see how your COVID experience changes over time. To participate, enter your preffered password to create an account!

questions.title: Create Account
questions.question: Please enter the verification code sent to your email

questions.title: Thank You
questions.question: Thank you for participating in the Johns Hopkins Long COVID survey. You will be emailed with a receipt of your survey entry shortly!
